   Description 
   
    Headquarters: Ottawa, Ontario 
     Industry: Technology/Aviation 
     Job Type: Full-time 
     About the Job 
     Searidge Technologies, a global leader and preferred partner for Remote Tower and Digital Airport solutions is currently recruiting for a Software Architect with an excellent understanding of software development, software system architecture design and the software development life cycle. The successful candidate will be responsible for the architecture design of Searidge’s software components and integrated software subsystems as well as the Searidge’s digital data platform that underpins all software components and products. The software architect role is an essential part of Searidge’s V-Model system development process, interfacing with both project delivery and software development teams. The software architect will analyze system-level requirements, derive software-level requirements, and design the software architecture, while ensuring the overall architectural principles are followed for the platform and all products. 
     This will be a permanent, full-time position, reporting to the Head of Platform and Products. 
     Responsibilities 
    
     Collaborate with Searidge project and software teams to create functional and non-functional software-level requirements 
     Collaborate with software testers to ensure the software-level requirements are adequately verified and validated 
     Use tools and software development methodologies to create high- and low-level software component and integrated software sub-system architecture design documentation 
     Documenting and recording software design selections and specifications 
     Actively seek ways to improve the architectural design of all Searidge products and the platform, with an aim to improve safety, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. 
     Provide technical guidance and mentoring to software developers, software testers, and project delivery teams 
     Ensure that software and sub-system designs follow a consistent design pattern and specification. 
     Communicate new concepts and guidelines to software developers and project delivery teams through documentation and presentations 
     Review and approve architecture-related information in software low-level design and high-level system design documentation 
    
    Qualifications 
    
     Computer Science Bachelor Degree or equivalent 
     5+ years experience in designing and implementing software applications 
     Solid understanding of development tooling and development platform 
     Excellent knowledge of software and application design and architecture 
     Demonstrated knowledge of real time applications, web applications, APIs, and cybersecurity 
     Experience with Helm, Docker, Kubernetes, Message Queues, SQL and No-SQL databases 
     Extensive experience with Message Queues, REST APIs and API architecture 
     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
     General understanding of software quality assurance principles 
     Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to see the big picture 
     Understanding of Linux systems 
     Must be a team player and willing to learn 
    
    Desired Qualifications 
    
     Experience in coding languages such as C++, JavaScript, and React 
     Hands-on experience with AWS technologies such as EC2, EKS, S3, Fargate and Lambda 
     Experience developing frontend and backend applications 
     Understanding of cybersecurity threats, solutions, and best practices 
     Familiarity with one or more languages in addition to English 
    
    Why Searidge? 
     Searidge Technologies is an innovative technology company working in the mission critical world of aviation. As a pioneer and global leader in Digital Tower and Advanced Airport solutions, our team is on the forefront of technology and driving change in how aircraft and vehicles in the vicinity of an airport have been traditionally managed. 
     As a member of the Searidge team, you will be part of exciting industry firsts, encounter challenging problems, be exposed to a variety of internal functions, and encouraged to learn, grow and expand both professionally and personally. 
     We are an equal opportunity employer offering competitive compensation, a respectful and positive work environment where creative solutions, empowerment, and collaboration to achieve our shared goals are part of our corporate DNA. 
     To Apply 
     Sounds like a good fit? If so, follow this link to apply via LinkedIn.
